body:
One or more automated tests failed
Refer to this link for build results: https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/12964/
Also @ryanlecompte since you changed the implementation to tail recursion, and @mateiz who wrote the original implementation.
Actually you will need to submit another PR. I've already merged this one (but github is laggy because it is waiting for the asf git bot to synchronize). Sorry about the confusion!
n.p. rebased and pushed to a new branch; see pull req #65.

Thanks for doing this.

BTW one thing I noticed is that your git commit's email is different from the ones you registered on github, so your commits don't actually show up as yours. You might want to fix that.

Aha, thanks for pointing that out. Should be fixed now.

On Sun, Mar 2, 2014 at 11:48 PM, Reynold Xin notifications@github.comwrote:

> Thanks for doing this.
> 
> BTW one thing I noticed is that your git commit's email is different from
> the ones you registered on github, so your commits don't actually show up
> as yours. You might want to fix that.
> 
> ## 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/apache/spark/pull/65#issuecomment-36487753
> .

Thanks for the detailed review Patrick.  I've updated based on the comments except for renaming the Handlers to Servlet and changing to use SparkConf.   I will make those changes shortly.

One or more automated tests failed
Refer to this link for build results: https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/12972/

Hi @jyotiska 

These docs are not meant to be consumed directly as markdown files. They are meant to be generated using jekyll (run jekyll build in docs folder), and they will create the documentation here: http://spark.incubator.apache.org/docs/latest/python-programming-guide.html

Changing the extension to .md breaks all the links.

This breaks Jekyll's code block formatting:

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/50748/2315605/c80bfdd0-a325-11e3-9cf6-8051590b96bc.png)

As @rxin said in #67, these docs aren't designed to be viewed on GitHub.  Here's a link to instructions on building the documentation using Jekyll: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/docs/README.md

Hey @ScrapCodes I had some more feedback on documentation and the build stuff. Instead of putting a bunch of comments I just made this pull request into your branch. Do you mind merging it?

https://github.com/ScrapCodes/spark-1/pull/1/files
I think once those are in this is basically ready to go.

@tdas should take a look at this actually, I think it was his code. But yes there's no reason to keep FIFO.
Alright, sounds good. Looking forward to it.

Ah, got it. In that case please expand the doc for the spark.mesos.checkpoint entry to explain that, and maybe link to the corresponding Mesos docs. Otherwise the current description makes it sound like there's no harm in having it on by default.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
I understand. Actually, all these links in Python programming guide was throwing 404. Not sure if this is only with me, but if the links are working fine for you I will close this PR.
I was meaning to ask about this. Can we do something to display the docs properly on both Github and website? I was bothered by how ugly the code snippets look when Github cannot render them.
Done. Please correct me if there's any mistake in my pool English. :D

Refer to this link for build results: https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/12976/

I think I just threw a bunch of different metrics together, I don't think this one was ever that useful.  It would be nice to have something to measure bandwidth, but I guess this isn't really useful.
I updated the code and tested the functionalities, everything goes well

All automated tests passed.
Refer to this link for build results: https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/12982/
Looks good to me. I'm going to merge it.
Maybe there was temporarily a wrong version of the docs published -- we republished them recently. But the links seem to work now, so I think it's fine to close the PR.

@kayousterhout @markhamstra @andrewor14 Thank you for your comments, 

I updated the code, how about this?
Hey Holden, wait on this a bit until https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/17 is merged. Then we'll also want to make sure it works with Java 8 (you'll need to make the class an interface and such).
Looks good to me too. I read through the updated docs and build instructions.
There is one thing to note, `-java-home` currently has a note, we can actually fix that. In the sense by moving check after process args.
@ScrapCodes hey sure feel free to submit a follow on PR. I'm going to merge this for now.
@pwendell Hey Patrick, It might be good to have jenkins not test the PRs which start with [WIP] or WIP. Or something like that ?
